ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Could these  errors  stop Heritix?
ygData.msgSnippet: Ahmed - The Contains non-LDH characters URL error is minor and advisory; it won t stop a crawl. The Stream closed error is more serious; the recovery log

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Could these  errors  stop Heritix?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=ylia4ZtflqEFJ2DxnGl-mSD9Kqz3gZ34Aj_sn4sU8DfK
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Ahmed -

The "Contains non-LDH characters" URL error is minor and advisory; it 
won't stop a crawl.

The "Stream closed" error is more serious; the recovery log shouldn't be 
closed mid-crawl and a problem with it could stop the crawl.

Were there any other errors in heritrix_out.log?

Is this repeatable, and if so, does it always happen after the same 
number of seconds/URIs?

Are you sure all disk paths written by Heritrix have free space and stay 
writable?

If the above doesn't lead to an answer, what Heritrix version and OS are 
you running?

- Gordon @ IA

ahmed ghouzia wrote:
>     After running for a few seconds, heritrix is crashed.
> I found the following URL error message in the logs/uri-error file ::
> 
> 
> 2007-08-10T15:01:27.978Z http://ml.typepad.com/ "gnu.inet.encoding.IDNAException: Contains non-LDH characters. <iframe%20src="http" http://<iframe src="http://rcm.amazon.com/e/cm?t=olivierbousquet&o=1&p=14&l=st1&mode=books&search=machine%20learning&=1&fc1=&lt1=&lc1=&bg1=&f=ifr" marginwidth="0" marginheight="0" width="160" height="600" border="0" frameborder="0" style="border:none;" sc
> 
> 
> and I found this error in heritrix-out log::
> 
> ava.io.IOException: Stream closed
>     at sun.nio.cs.StreamEncoder.ensureOpen(StreamEncoder.java:26)
>     at sun.nio.cs.StreamEncoder.write(StreamEncoder.java:99)
>     at sun.nio.cs.StreamEncoder.write(StreamEncoder.java:116)
>     at java.io.OutputStreamWriter.write(OutputStreamWriter.java:203)
>     at java.io.Writer.write(Writer.java:140)
>     at org.archive.crawler.io.CrawlerJournal.writeLine(CrawlerJournal.java:164)
>     at org.archive.crawler.frontier.RecoveryJournal.emitted(RecoveryJournal.java:113)
>     at org.archive.crawler.frontier.AbstractFrontier.doJournalEmitted(AbstractFrontier.java:418)
>     at org.archive.crawler.frontier.AbstractFrontier.noteAboutToEmit(AbstractFrontier.java:688)
>     at org.archive.crawler.frontier.WorkQueueFrontier.next(WorkQueueFrontier.java:636)
>     at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.run(ToeThread.java:144)
> 
> I do not know which one of them crashed the system?
> 
> Thanks for your help in advance
>
